objects.description:
Monitor for changes made to command history files, such as ConsoleHost_history.txt, ~/.zsh_history, or ~/.bash_history, for unexpected modifications to contents, access permissions, and attributes.

Implementation 1 : Modification of access rights to command history files

Detection Pseudocode
suspicious_files = filter ProcessGuid, ProcessFilePath, UserName, FilePath where (event_id == "4663" AND FilePath LIKE '%ConsoleHost_history.txt%' AND ObjectType == "File" AND (UserAccessList LIKE '%1539%' or UserAccessList LIKE '%WRITE_DAC%')) OR (event_id == "4670" AND FilePath LIKE '%ConsoleHost_history.txt%' AND ObjectType == "File" AND (ObjectNewSd LIKE '%;FA%' OR ObjectNewSd LIKE '%;FW%' OR ObjectNewSd LIKE '%;BU%'))

Detection Notes

- For Security Auditing event id 4663 and 4670, enable success events for category Object Access and subcategory File System. - For Security Auditing event id 4663, a System Access Control List (SACL) that controls the use of specific access rights such as WRITE_DAC is required for event generation. - For Security Auditing event id 4663 and 4670, depending on the File Path you are monitoring, the implementation of a new System Access Control List (SACL) might be required. - For Security Auditing event id 4670, FA right means File all access right, FW right means File generic write, BU trustee means Built-in users.
